revised_title: A Detailed Account of Leprosy Symptoms and Transmission in the Isle of Guadaloupe
tldr: The author provides a detailed account of the symptoms and transmission of leprosy in the Isle of Guadaloupe. The disease begins with small, unnoticeable spots on the skin that gradually worsen over time, affecting the nose, ears, fingers, and toes. The author also discusses the hereditary and infectious nature of the disease, as well as its incurable status. Public health measures were taken to visit and isolate affected individuals to prevent the spread of the disease.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Infectious Diseases
